segment.source: How to Create and Test a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Create and Test a MED-V Image

segment.source: How to Create and Test a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Create and Test a MED-V Image

segment.source: How to Create and Test a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Create and Test a MED-V Image

segment.source: The MED-V administrator creates a MED-V image so that it can be uploaded, associated with a MED-V workspace, and then distributed to the client over the Web, added to a MED-V package, or downloaded to the client by using a third-party system.
segment.target: The MED-V administrator creates a MED-V image so that it can be uploaded, associated with a MED-V workspace, and then distributed to the client over the Web, added to a MED-V package, or downloaded to the client by using a third-party system.

segment.source: It is recommended to first create a test image and test it on MED-V client before deploying it.
segment.target: It is recommended to first create a test image and test it on MED-V client before deploying it.

segment.source: When creating a MED-V image, it goes through the following stages:
segment.target: When creating a MED-V image, it goes through the following stages:

segment.source: Local test image—A basic image that can be tested locally.
segment.target: Local test image—A basic image that can be tested locally.

segment.source: Local packed image—After the image is tested, the image is packed as it existed prior to testing.
segment.target: Local packed image—After the image is tested, the image is packed as it existed prior to testing.

segment.source: No changes made during testing are included in the packed image.
segment.target: No changes made during testing are included in the packed image.

segment.source: Packed image on server—The packed image is uploaded to the server.
segment.target: Packed image on server—The packed image is uploaded to the server.

segment.source: How to Create a MED-V Test Image
segment.target: How to Create a MED-V Test Image

segment.source: To create a new MED-V test image
segment.target: To create a new MED-V test image

segment.source: Click the Images management button.
segment.target: Click the Images management button.

segment.source: The Images module appears.
segment.target: The Images module appears.

segment.source: The Images module consists of the following panes:
segment.target: The Images module consists of the following panes:

segment.source: Local Test Images—Local unpacked images.
segment.target: Local Test Images—Local unpacked images.

segment.source: Local Packed Images—All packed images on the local computer.
segment.target: Local Packed Images—All packed images on the local computer.

segment.source: Packed Images on Server—All images that have been packed and uploaded to the server.
segment.target: Packed Images on Server—All images that have been packed and uploaded to the server.

segment.source: In the Local Packed Images and Packed Images on Server panes, the most recent version of each image is displayed as the parent node.
segment.target: In the Local Packed Images and Packed Images on Server panes, the most recent version of each image is displayed as the parent node.

segment.source: Click the parent node to view all other existing versions of the image.
segment.target: Click the parent node to view all other existing versions of the image.

segment.source: In the Local Test Images pane, click New.
segment.target: In the Local Test Images pane, click New.

segment.source: On the Test Image Creation dialog box, select the virtual machine image that you want to configure as a MED-V test image by doing one of the following:
segment.target: On the Test Image Creation dialog box, select the virtual machine image that you want to configure as a MED-V test image by doing one of the following:

segment.source: In the Base image file field, type the full path to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.
segment.target: In the Base image file field, type the full path to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.

segment.source: Click Browse to browse to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.
segment.target: Click Browse to browse to the directory where the Microsoft Virtual PC image prepared for MED-V is located.

segment.source: In the Image name field, type or select the desired name.
segment.target: In the Image name field, type or select the desired name.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The following characters cannot be included in the image name: space " / : ?
segment.target: The following characters cannot be included in the image name: space " / : ?

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: A new MED-V test image is created on your host computer with the properties defined in the following table.
segment.target: A new MED-V test image is created on your host computer with the properties defined in the following table.

segment.source: For more information about configuring the MED-V workspace image, refer to Configuring MED-V Workspace Policies.
segment.target: For more information about configuring the MED-V workspace image, refer to Configuring MED-V Workspace Policies.

segment.source: Local Test Images Properties
segment.target: Local Test Images Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Image Name
segment.target: Image Name

segment.source: The name of the test image as it was defined when the administrator created the image.
segment.target: The name of the test image as it was defined when the administrator created the image.

segment.source: Image Path
segment.target: Image Path

segment.source: The local path of the test image.
segment.target: The local path of the test image.

segment.source: Created
segment.target: Created

segment.source: The date the test image was created.
segment.target: The date the test image was created.

segment.source: How to Test a MED-V Image from the MED-V Client
segment.target: How to Test a MED-V Image from the MED-V Client

segment.source: After a MED-V test image is created, use the following procedure to test the image locally.
segment.target: After a MED-V test image is created, use the following procedure to test the image locally.

segment.source: To test a MED-V image
segment.target: To test a MED-V image

segment.source: Click the Policy management button.
segment.target: Click the Policy management button.

segment.source: In the Policy module, assign the MED-V test image to a MED-V workspace by doing the following:
segment.target: In the Policy module, assign the MED-V test image to a MED-V workspace by doing the following:

segment.source: Click the Virtual Machine tab.
segment.target: Click the Virtual Machine tab.

segment.source: In the Assigned Image field, select the MED-V test image you created.
segment.target: In the Assigned Image field, select the MED-V test image you created.

segment.source: If your test image is not in the list, click Refresh.
segment.target: If your test image is not in the list, click Refresh.

segment.source: On the toolbar, click Save changes.
segment.target: On the toolbar, click Save changes.

segment.source: Configure any other MED-V workspace settings to be tested.
segment.target: Configure any other MED-V workspace settings to be tested.

segment.source: For more information, see Configuring MED-V Workspace Policies.
segment.target: For more information, see Configuring MED-V Workspace Policies.

segment.source: Start MED-V client.
segment.target: Start MED-V client.

segment.source: In the Confirm Running Test confirmation box, click Use Test Image.
segment.target: In the Confirm Running Test confirmation box, click Use Test Image.

segment.source: Test the MED-V workspace test image.
segment.target: Test the MED-V workspace test image.

segment.source: For information about starting and running MED-V client, see MED-V Client Operations.
segment.target: For information about starting and running MED-V client, see MED-V Client Operations.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: While testing an image, do not open VPC and make changes to the image.
segment.target: While testing an image, do not open VPC and make changes to the image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When testing an image, no changes are saved to the image between sessions; instead, they are saved in a separate, temporary file.
segment.target: When testing an image, no changes are saved to the image between sessions; instead, they are saved in a separate, temporary file.

segment.source: This is to ensure that when the image is packed and run on the production environment, it is the original, clean image.
segment.target: This is to ensure that when the image is packed and run on the production environment, it is the original, clean image.
